variant.p: The Board concluded that retrospective application made by amending the comparative information presented for prior periods is preferable to the previously allowed alternative treatments because, under the now required method of retrospective application:

li.p: profit or loss for the period of the change does not include the effects of changes in accounting policies or errors relating to prior periods.

information presented about prior periods is prepared on the same basis as information about the current period, and is therefore comparable. This information possesses a qualitative characteristic identified in the Framework for the Preparation and Presentation of Financial Statements (Framework), and provides the most useful information for trend analysis of income and expenses.
prior period errors are not repeated in comparative information presented for prior periods.
